Ambergris is in fact usually spewed up by the whale.

Actually, concerning ambergris, "poop" is a misnomer here, as it's really not fecal matter. This substance clumps around hard parts of squids, the beaks, and protects intestines from being ruptured. It's often ejected through regurgitation in small amounts, but sometimes it makes its way into the intestinal tract where it builds up in size to eventual expulsion out the rectum. So yes, it passes through the same path as poop, but it's not really poop.

Well, the 4 examples that you brought up, Ambrox, Sandalwood (Santalol), Vanillin and even some macrocyclic musks, can nowadays be produced by synthetic biology --i.e. using engineered microbes to produce these molecules by fermentation, from sugar or other abundant natural precursors. In some cases (e.g. vanillin and Ambrox) these products are still more expensive than the ones made by chemical synthesis, but they are natural and sustainable. So demand is going up and cost is going down. SynBio is here to stay.
